data.title: Installation Step 1: Upload ShortPoint SPFx to App Catalog (SharePoint 2019)
data.meta_description: This article tackles how to upload ShortPoint SPFx to your App Catalog.
data.text:
This is the first step of the ShortPoint SPFx installation for SharePoint 2019. This article will walk you through how to upload ShortPoint SPFx to your App Catalog.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

Before we begin

Step-by-Step Tutorial

Step 1: Go to Central Administration

Step 2: Go to Manage App Catalog

Step 3: Open App Catalog

Step 4: Go to Apps for SharePoint library

Step 5: Download the latest version of ShortPoint SPFx

Step 6: Upload ShortPoint SPFx to App Catalog

Step 7: Verify if ShortPoint SPFx was deployed successfully

Before we begin

This article is for SharePoint 2019 Farm Server. Make sure you have completed the following steps for your Web Application before you proceed with this article:

Prerequisite 1: Set up App Catalog(Setup for each Web Application where you want to use ShortPoint)

Prerequisite 2: Enable Scripting Capabilities(required if you want to use ShortPoint on classic sites and pages)

Prerequisite 3: Enable IIS 6 Metabase Compatibility

Step-by-Step Tutorial

Step 1: Go to Central Administration

From your SharePoint 2019 Farm Server, open SharePoint 2019 Central Administration

Step 2: Go to Manage App Catalog

On the Central Administration page, select Apps from the side panel.

Under App Management, click Manage App Catalog.

Step 3: Open App Catalog

Click the link under Site URL.

You will be redirected to your App Catalog.

Step 4: Go to Apps for SharePoint library

On your App Catalog page, select Apps for SharePoint from the side menu.

Step 5: Download the latest version of ShortPoint SPFx

Download the latest version of ShortPoint SPFx

Extract the file ShortPoint-SPFx_XXXX.zip

After extracting, you will find the shortpoint-spfx.sppkg file.

Upload shortpoint-spfx.sppkg as described in the next step.

Step 6: Upload ShortPoint SPFx to App Catalog

On the Apps for SharePoint page, click New.

A pop-up window will appear. Click Choose Files:

Look for the shortpoint-spfx.sppkg file you extracted earlier and click Open.

Then, click OK.

After the upload is completed successfully, you will be prompted to deploy the solution. Click Deploy.

You will then see a message indicating that the upload was completed successfully.

Step 7: Verify if ShortPoint SPFx was deployed successfully

To check if ShortPoint SPFx was deployed successfully, look at the Deployed column. Make sure that you see Yes under it to confirm deployment success.

That's it! You have now uploaded ShortPoint SPFx to your App Catalog. Now, you can proceed to Add ShortPoint SPFx to a SharePoint Site.

Related Articles:

Prerequisite 2: Enable Scripting Capabilities

Prerequisite 3: Enable IIS 6 Metabase Compatibility
